page.title: 02General view and Gazeteer
page.content: The block straddles the River Exe Estuary. At this point, the water is 1.5 km wide and tidal. The western side is low lying flood plain, mainly flat park and meadow land, and includes the southern part of the Exeter canal which ends at the Turf Hotel. To the south is part of the Powderham Estate,home of the Earls of Devonshire. On the west, terraces rise to 50m and two villages are sited where tributaries join the Exe. Exton and Lympstone have both grown into commuter and retirement centres. The Royal Marine Training camp lies between the two.The area is scenically notable and provides leisure and recreational opportunities for the people of the nearby larger centres of Exeter and Exmouth.
